description: Great app, would recommend
Just hat to download it because it was one of the first officially published apps using gtk4
summary: Works and is one of the first gtk4 app

description: Otherwise this app is good
summary: Not a a fan of the logo

description: Minimalist, functional!
It does what it says but with no apparent way to modify the time lengths or notification sounds/length.
The app works, but you can't customize anything.
summary: No way to modify the times

description: Fedora GNOME 40, I use adwaita dark but this app stays white.

If you want to do anything other than the standard 25 to 5 pomodoro technique then this is not the app for you. If you do want standard pomodoro but want a dark theme, this is not the app for you. There are zero options for any customization and even they keyboard shortcuts offer no value at all. If you want the bare minimum a pomodoro app should have then this will be fine but other than that . . . keep looking. I hope they improve it though, it has potential.
summary: Accomplishes the basic task but thats it

description: Helps me a lot to get work done.
The app ignores your theme, dark mode doesn't carry over onto the app. Other than that it looks and works great... please allow themes I want dark mode...
That's a great app if you want something simple and easy to use, without functionality overloads. It has a polished design and the app does its job well.
summary: Is it complex? No. Does it work perfectly? Yes

description: This might be my favourite pomodoro app. Love the simple and graceful design.
summary: Looks great, gets the job done

description: Great, minimalistic app that helps you concentrate by adding frequent short breaks. Other reviews are saying that dark mode doesn't work, but dark mode works for me on Fedora 36 GNOME 42.1.
summary: Both app and dark mode work

description: a simple app that does what it has to do, and nothing more

I haven't had any bugs occur, which is the most important thing for a simple app like this. Seems to follow Gnome HIG so thats cool. Nice looking and practical. I use this along with Furtherance to manage my studying.

Works well enough, but it'd be nice if the lap counter sustained beyond each "set." Currently it resets the lap counter after every long break. Not a huge deal, but you have to remember the number of sets yourself if you want to log your time.
summary: Does its job but could use lap counter past long break

description: doesnt respect GTK_THEME flatpak setting

Solanum does one thing, and it does it right. It fits in with my GNOME desktop, and the form factor is perfect for this kind of application. It isn't overloaded with extra features, and only does just what I need. The use cases for it are many: Schoolwork, coding, hobbies in general, etc.

This is an excellent app. It's very simple, but has just enough that it doesn't get in the way and let's you get on with things. I highly recommend this, especially to people who can't seem to find where all their attention is going.
summary: Great app, very simple and helps me stay on track

description: The timer doesn't restart after changing the settings. The timer doesn't continue immidiately after the session is over. It just doesn't feel right
summary: Needs some more features and qol improvements

description:
The app is very simple and easy to use, it does the basics of a pomodoro clock. However there are a few features that would be greatly helpful if added (to preferences), such as: customised ring tones; an always on top option; different colour/opacity schemes.

It's a very linux app, which is both good and a pity.
summary: Simple, and does exactly what is expected

description: very goooood!
Great, simple look, settings for session lenght and simply smooth expierence, recommended!
Simple and gets the job done.

I don't war and peace, I don't want a million functions, I just want 30 minutes computer work, 10 minutes up and busy work - all day - from the time I pull the PC out of stand by until the time I throw it back into stand by.

AND I am SO glad the coders wrote in the basic function of a Pomodore timer - so I can rig it to run 30 cycles until the long break happens which is never... just 30 minutes site and 10 minutes up and active - all day.
summary: This is simple and I approve

description: I would've never expected my favorite pomodoro app to be some random app I just saw in app store, but none other I've installed compares. That said, it might be able to use more features.

simple, effective, great sounds too .

 so awesome. respect to the devs
summary: I really love this app and wish they had one for macos..

description: lack of stats makes it unusable for me
It looks good, does what I need, and has a calming chime sound. 10/10
Everything worked perfectly. No more annoying pomodoro websites.
summary: Does one job, and does it well

description: It works great on my gnome fedora, very useful. But the sound could be heard more often, like an alarm, until it clicks to start the brake.

I tried a few Pomodoro timers (on Windows) and after switching to Linux, I can say that this is the best. It does not automatically proceed from work session to break and vice versa, but also does not leave it up to the user to think of clicking the buttons. It just shows a notification, you click, it goes on counting. The sounds are clearly audible but not annoying. There is no clutter like planting trees or reviewing your working time. It's wonderful.
Me gusta mucho su interfaz pero es demasiado simple, me gustaría un registro de los pomodoros hechos junto con un sistema de etiquetas para saber cuanto tiempo le dedico a cada tarea.
Me parecio mejor que otras opciones de pomodoros. Siento que le falta la opcion de cambiar de timbre y de subir o bajar el volumen del timbre
Fait bien son trvail !
В трей не сворачивается, запускается ужасно долго, работает только в заявленном "помидорном" режиме, то есть свои интервалы времени задать не получится.
summary: только если вам действительно очень нужен помидор

description: Нужен был таймер, который бы запускался на работу и отдых вручную. Пока что Solanum - такой единственный из перепробованных, все остальные работают так, что автоматически переключаются на отдых, а потом далее на работу, что далеко не всегда удобно. С Solanum "метод помидора" для баланса работы и отдыха у меня реально заработал. Спасибо за приложение!
Без функций....
Минималистичный и удобный таймер помидоро, функций мне хватает
